alert.note: Alert for Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 4:43AM CDT until October 24 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Texas, including the following county, Wichita. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 443 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wichita Falls. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
